title: North Meets South Web Podcast
description: Jacob Bennett and Michael Dyrynda conquer a 14.5 hour time difference to talk about life as web developers

items.title: Podcasting, side hustles, and the importance of being earnest
items.content_text: In this episode, Jake and Michael are joined by up-and-coming Laravel community members Caleb Porzio and Daniel Coulbourne for a casual chat about a wide array of topics from podcasting, to side hustles, and the importance of being earnest.
items.content_html:

items.title: Making users, shared sessions, and production deployments

items.title: Non-recording, updating Laravel, and huge manatees

items.title: Denials of Service, MacBooks, and reviewing other people's code
items.content_text: Jake and Michael relive the disconnection as a result of the great DDoS attack of October 2016, discuss changes in Laravel 5.3.19, rumoured features of the upcoming (and long overdue) MacBook refresh, as well as talk about working with and reviewing other people's code.

Jake and Michael relive the disconnection as a result of the great DDoS attack of October 2016, discuss changes in Laravel 5.3.19, rumoured features of the upcoming (and long overdue) MacBook refresh, as well as talk about working with and reviewing other people's code.

items.summary: This episode sees Jacob and Michael interview their first guest, co-host of the Dads in Development podcast, David Hemphill. We get to know a little bit about where David is from, how he got to where he is, and what he does.

items.title: Wrong Abstractions, Valet, and MailThief
items.content_text: In this episode, Jacob and Michael discuss Sandi Metz's article "The Wrong Abstraction", Laravel Valet and their experiences with developing on both Mac and Windows, and the new mail testing package from Tighten Co, MailThief.
items.content_html:
In this episode, Jacob and Michael discuss Sandi Metz's article "The Wrong Abstraction", Laravel Valet and their experiences with developing on both Mac and Windows, and the new mail testing package from Tighten Co, MailThief.

items.title: Refactoring to Laracon
items.content_text: In this episode, Jacob and Michael talk about the upcoming Laracon US in Louisville, Kentucky and share their thoughts on Adam Wathan's recently released Refactoring to Collections book.
items.content_html:
In this episode, Jacob and Michael talk about the upcoming Laracon US in Louisville, Kentucky and share their thoughts on Adam Wathan's recently released Refactoring to Collections book.

  • Laracon US
  • Refactoring to Collections by Adam Wathan
  • Review: Adam Wathan's Refactoring to Collections

Adam has graciously offered a 25% discount to the first ten listeners who use the coupon code "northmeetssouth" 🔥
